alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 8:01PM CST until January 01 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, snow and gusty winds likely on New Year`s Day, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. The greatest potential for 6 inches or more resides southeast of a line from Geneva Nebraska to Phillipsburg Kansas. Brisk north winds sustained 15 to 25 MPH and gusting up to 35 MPH will cause blowing and drifting snow along with reduced visibilities. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as frigid as 15 to 25 degrees below zero are expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska, south of the Tri Cities. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight Friday night through noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 3 AM CST Saturday morning through 9 PM CST Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and blowing snow. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There continues to be modest uncertainty regarding the exact track of this storm and location of the heaviest snow band. Be sure to stay up to date with later forecasts, as even a minor shift in the storm track could result in meaningful changes to forecast snowfall amounts.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster
